intro: Cruciata taurica subsp. armenica, commonly known as Armenian crosswort, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water. It is often found in mountainous areas of Armenia and adjacent regions.
